CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Mihai Poalelungi;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings against PERSON , a journalist , and ORG , a publishing company , claiming non - pecuniary damages for suffering and distress due to an article published in DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( käräjäoikeus , tingsrätten ) held an oral hearing . On DATE it rejected the action , holding that publishing the name of a convicted person did not amount to an offence and that , therefore , no right to compensation existed under LAW , section CARDINAL , of LAW ( vahingonkorvauslaki , skadeståndslagen ; Act no . CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . The applicant appealed . On DATE he changed counsel .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( hovioikeus , hovrätten ) held an oral hearing . On DATE the court partly upheld the applicant 's claim and ordered the journalist and the publishing company jointly to pay the applicant LAW for suffering and distress . The court found that there had been no justification for publishing the name of a private person such as the applicant .
CARDINAL . All the parties requested leave to appeal , which was granted on DATE .
CARDINAL . In its judgment of DATE ( precedent no . ORG CARDINAL:CARDINAL ) ORG ( korkein oikeus , högsta domstolen ) overturned the appellate court 's judgment and rejected the action .
